Question:
A list of various quantities is shown.
acceleration
displacement
force
length
mass
velocity

How many of these quantities are vectors?

A student determines the circumference of a football.
Which instrument gives a reading that is the circumference of the football?

A train sets off from a station at time t = 0.
The graph shows how the distance between the train and the station varies with time.
Which statement about the movement of the train between time t1 and t2 is correct?

Options.A: Its speed is decreasing and it is moving away from the station.
Options.B: Its speed is decreasing and it is moving towards the station.
Options.C: Its speed is increasing and it is moving away from the station.
Options.D: Its speed is increasing and it is moving towards the station.

Question:
A coin falls from rest through the air and eventually reaches a constant speed.
There is a resultant force acting on the coin due to the two forces P and Q shown in the diagram.
What happens to force P and what happens to the resultant force before the coin reaches constant speed?

Options.A: Force P decreases, Resultant force increases
Options.B: Force P decreases, Resultant force decreases
Options.C: Force P increases, Resultant force decreases
Options.D: Force P increases, Resultant force increases

Question:
A satellite is shown moving around the Earth in a circular path at a constant speed.
Which arrow shows the direction of the force on the satellite?

Which row shows the mass and the weight of an object on the Earth’s surface?
[gravitational field strength g = 10 N / kg]

Water is added to a measuring cylinder containing 100 cm3 of liquid paraffin.
(The density of paraffin is 0.80 g / cm3 and that of the water is 1.0 g / cm3.)
As the water is added, the level of the paraffin rises to 150 cm3. The paraffin and water do not mix.
What finally is the total mass of liquid in the measuring cylinder?

A horizontal beam is pivoted at X. A mass of 200 g rests on the beam as shown. The centre of mass of the beam is 50 cm from the right-hand end of the beam.
The beam is balanced.
What is the mass of the beam?
Where on the graph is the limit of proportionality for an elastic solid?

A sealed gas syringe contains a fixed mass of gas.
The piston is moved and the volume of the gas doubles. The temperature of the gas does not change.
What happens to the pressure of the gas?
Which expression for pressure is correct?

At a depth d in sea-water, the total pressure experienced by a diver is 2P, where P is atmospheric pressure.
At which depth is the pressure 4P?

The work done by a force F on a body is calculated by multiplying F by a quantity q.
What is q?

Options.A: The distance travelled in the direction of the force
Options.B: The distance travelled perpendicular to the direction of the force
Options.C: The velocity in the direction of the force
Options.D: The velocity in the direction perpendicular to the force

Question:
Some solar panels have a total area of 12 m2.
Each 1.0 m2 of the panels receives 0.85 kJ of energy from the Sun in 1.0 s.
The efficiency of the panels is 16%.
How much power do they produce?

A copper rod is heated at one end.
Which statement describes how heat transfer occurs in the copper?

Options.A: Energetic copper molecules move from the cooler end to the hotter end.
Options.B: Energetic copper molecules move from the hotter end to the cooler end.
Options.C: Energetic free electrons move from the cooler end to the hotter end.
Options.D: Energetic free electrons move from the hotter end to the cooler end.

Question:
The diagram shows a clinical thermometer.
Which factor affects the sensitivity of the thermometer?

Options.C: The length of the glass tube
Options.D: The thickness of the glass tube

Question: Which row is correct for a thermocouple thermometer?

Options.A: Measures very high temperatures: No, Responds quickly to change in temperature: No
Options.B: Measures very high temperatures: No, Responds quickly to change in temperature: Yes
Options.C: Measures very high temperatures: Yes, Responds quickly to change in temperature: No
Options.D: Measures very high temperatures: Yes, Responds quickly to change in temperature: Yes

Question: What is the heat capacity of a body?

Options.A: The amount of thermal energy that the body can absorb without melting
Options.B: The amount of thermal energy required to raise the temperature of the body by 1.0 ยฐC
Options.C: The amount of thermal energy required to raise the temperature of 1.0 kg of the body by 1.0 ยฐC
Options.D: The amount of thermal energy required to raise the temperature of 1.0 mยณ of the body by 1.0 ยฐC

Question: Which statement about water is correct?

Options.A: At the boiling point, water vapour molecules have the same kinetic energy as liquid water molecules
Options.B: Evaporation occurs only at the boiling point
Options.C: Water molecules become heavier when water freezes
Options.D: Water molecules lose all of their kinetic energy when water freezes

Question:
A water wave in a ripple tank refracts as it moves from deep water into shallower water.
What happens to the speed and to the frequency of the wave as it moves into shallower water?

Light refracts from a liquid into air as shown.
The refractive index for light moving from air to the liquid is 1.4.
What is the angle of incidence in the liquid?

A ray of red light in air enters a semi-circular block.
Which diagram shows the partial reflection and the refraction of the ray?
Which statement about human vision is correct?

Options.A: In a normal eye, the image on the retina is magnified and upright
Options.B: In a long-sighted eye, distant objects form images in front of the retina
Options.C: Short-sighted eyes produce only virtual images
Options.D: Short-sight is corrected by the use of a diverging lens

Question:
White light enters a prism and forms a spectrum.
The rays in the air are labelled.
Which diagram shows how the white light is dispersed by the prism?

The sound from a ship is reflected by a cliff. An echo is heard by a sailor on the ship 4.0 s after the sound is made. The speed of sound in air is 320 m / s.
How far from the cliff is the ship?

End X of a metal rod attracts the North pole of a compass needle.
Which statement about the rod is correct?

Options.A: It is made of copper that is not initially magnetised
Options.B: It is made of copper with a South pole at X
Options.C: It is made of steel that is not initially magnetised
Options.D: It is made of steel with a North pole at X

Question: Which diagram shows the pattern and direction of the electric field lines near a positive charge?

A positively charged rod is held close to an insulated metal sphere. The sphere is earthed as shown.
The earth connection is removed and then the rod is removed.
Which diagram shows the charges on the sphere after the rod is removed?

The diagram shows an electrostatic precipitator. It can be used to remove dust from air.
What happens at the negative grid?

A 100 W lamp is switched on for five hours each day for three weeks.
The cost of one unit of electricity is $0.24.
How much does it cost to run the lamp for this time?

The information on the back of an electric room heater is shown.
What is a suitable fuse rating for this room heater?

The diagram shows a horizontal rectangular wire coil WXYZ between the poles of a magnet.
Which statement is correct?

Options.A: The side WX experiences an upward force
Options.B: The side XY experiences an outward force
Options.C: The side YZ experiences an inward force
Options.D: The side ZW experiences a downward force

Question: Which energy transfer takes place in an electric kettle?

The diagram shows a current-carrying conductor between the poles of a magnet. The force on the wire acts downwards.
Which two changes made together keep the force acting downwards?

In an alternating current (a.c.) generator, a magnet rotates near a coil of wire. The induced electromotive force (e.m.f.) in the coil is displayed on an oscilloscope screen.
Which trace is produced as the magnet slows down?

A student uses a transformer to light a filament lamp using a 230 V a.c. supply. The lamp has a maximum voltage rating of 6.0 V.
What happens when the circuit is switched on?

Options.A: The lamp does not light at all
Options.B: The lamp lights at normal brightness
Options.D: The lamp lights up brightly and then goes out

Question: Which statement about nuclear fusion is correct?

Options.A: Nuclear fusion occurs at low temperatures
Options.B: Nuclear fusion occurs only between heavy nuclei
Options.C: Nuclear fusion occurs in the formation of many stars
Options.D: Nuclear fusion powers most electricity-generating stations

Question:
In one radioactive decay, radium-226 decays to radon-222 as shown.
Which particles are also produced?

Options.A: Both an alpha-particle and a beta-particle

Question:
A radiation detector is placed 5.0 cm from a radioactive source.
The count rate of the radiation is measured.
The detector is now placed 10 cm from the source.
What is the new count rate?

Options.A: one-quarter of the original count rate
Options.C: the same as the original count rate

Question:
The diagram shows the apparatus used to demonstrate the deflection of alpha-particles in an electric field.
What is the charge on an alpha-particle and to which plate is it deflected?
